article:
'Barney Aaron' (born November 21, 1800, at Aldgate; died in 1850 in London,
England) was an English bare-knuckle boxer.

The father of Hall of Famer Young Barney Aaron began boxing in 1819 and became a
Lightweight Champion in the 1820s. [http://books.google.com/books?id=aA2LO_-
DGdu4C&printsec=frontcover&dq=The+Boxing+Register:+International+Boxing+Hall+of-
+Fame+Official+Record+Book&hl=fr&ei=wVddTKXOLaOUOPvGvMIP&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct-
=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCoQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false The Boxing Register:
International Boxing Hall of Fame Official Record Book] (page 14) Called
The Star of the East, Aaron got victories over William Connelly, Ned Stockton,
Lenney, Frank Redmond and Peter Warren. He was inducted into the International
Boxing Hall of Fame in 2001.
